title: PC Andrew Harper funeral: Family and colleagues say last goodbye to murdered officer
text:

Hero police officer Andrew Harper is being laid to rest today after being killed in the line of duty.

The 28-year-old was allegedly dragged to his death by a burglary getaway van weeks after he got married to sweetheart Lissie.

Hundreds of well-wishers, including colleagues at Thames Valley Police, are gathered at the hero police officer's funeral in Oxford this morning.

Flags are flying at half-mast across the whole of the force's patch as the officer is buried at Christ Church Cathedral in the city.

The service commenced there at 11am.

Craig O’Leary, chairman of the force’s federation for rank-and-file officers, said: "It is our sad duty today to pay our last respects to him and support his wife Lissie, his family and his friends at his funeral.

(Image: PA)

"Police officers go to work each and every day to fight crime and protect the public.

"Sadly on very rare occasions a colleague makes the ultimate sacrifice. We will ensure that heroism is never forgotten."

The public have been invited to pay their respects to PC Harper along the processional route.

PC Harper’s family requested no flowers were brought to the cathedral, procession or thrown at the cortege.

(Image: DAVID HARTLEY)

(Image: PA)

Instead, they asked for donations to be made to the Tiggywinkles Wildlife Hospital in Haddenham, or the Blue Cross re-homing centre in nearby Lewknor.

PC Harper was the first policeman to be killed since PC Keith Palmer was stabbed to death during the Westminster terror attack in 2017.

The husband, who joined the force as a special constable in 2010, worked for the Roads Policing Proactive Unit.

(Image: DAVID HARTLEY)

(Image: PA)

(Image: DAVID HARTLEY)

He had been called to a burglary in Sulhamstead, Berkshire, when he was killed.

In a heartbreaking tribute after PC Harper's death, grief-stricken Lissie said: "Anyone who was lucky enough to meet you, whether they knew you as Andrew, Andy, Uncle Mann, Harps or PC Harper...to everyone you are a hero.

"You had the best sense of humour and never took life too seriously. You treasured every moment and always had a smile on your face."

(Image: Jonathan Buckmaster)

(Image: DAVID HARTLEY)

Three teens last month appeared in court charged with PC Harper's murder and conspiracy to steal a quad bike.

Henry Long, 18, and two 17-year-old's who can't be identified, were remanded in custody.

Thomas King, 21, has also been charged with conspiracy to steal a quad bike and has been released on conditional bail.

Jed Foster, 20, had been charged with murder but prosecutors at the Old Bailey revealed they were no longer pursuing the case against him.
description: PC Andrew Harper, who was killed in the line of duty in Sulhamstead, Berkshire, in August, is due to be buried at Christ Church Cathedral in central Oxford today
